subject: Factorisation of the unix socket path computation
commitMessage:
Factorisation of the unix socket path computation

The code that was appearing 3 times, doing the same thing
is factorized in a single function.

A check to a not possible error is removed.

Some memory clean-up is added to avoid a memory leak.

This commit prepares to multi-user because the path of the
unix sockets may depend of the user. Then having a central
place to perform this computation is simplier.

Change-Id: I88a4df4951bd240aef82e6960b9f91e6e4f1067d
Signed-off-by: José Bollo <jose.bollo@open.eurogiciel.org>

subject: Remove hardcoded path for multiuser support
commitMessage:
Remove hardcoded path for multiuser support

Change-Id: I47f9455d66002ba870cf16dab95951d671800175
Bug-Tizen: PTREL-273
Signed-off-by: Sabera Djelti (sdi2) <sabera.djelti@open.eurogiciel.org>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.
Uploaded patch set 2.

Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

Patch Set 2:

Michael: I understand your concerns regarding macros usage. But the first fixes for multiuser mode must be as simple as possible, i.e. replacing hardcoded paths by dynamic call everywhere.

If you take a look at tzplatform_mkpath() and other functions in libtzplatform-config, you'll see that it's safe because the calls are reentrant and always return the same pointer after the first calculation. So there's no leak.

Later, when the 200+ packages will be corrected, we'll be able to open bugs to fix this kind of macros definitions (grepping in the code will be easy).

Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)

Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)
Uploaded patch set 3.
Patch Set 3: Verified+1
Uploaded patch set 4.
Uploaded patch set 5.
Patch Set 5: Verified+1

Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

Multi user activation.
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Fix compatibility for x64 arch.

owner.name: Baptiste (DO NOT USE) DURAND (DO NOT USE)

commitMessage:
Fix compatibility for x64 arch.

- Fix Warning about cast int to pointer.

intptr type is used because there are  only ID value that casted in pointer.

Store an ID on integer make sense, and cast is used only to permits a call function.

- Remove warning around variable set but not used.
